questions.question_text:
A developer needs to automate a process which involves capturing support ticket numbers from the email subject line. For example, the email subject line includes: "Action Required â€“ XA/135" where "XA/135" is the ticket number. The robot should validate the pattern of the ticket number before proceeding.
Which expression exclusively matches the ticket number pattern from the subject line?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If you want to match exactley "XA/135", and you will test in studio the answer will be D.
The pattern expresion is: "(\w{2})/(\d{3})".

Selected Answer: D
Ans : D
Ans : D

Selected Answer: D
D works fine

Selected Answer: A
You want to extract the Number from the entire Subject of the mail, so you have to include Anything in the regex.

comments.content: Ok the correct answer is D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
if make operation starting without "", then will be operation of adding numbers. If we do the addition starting with the number between the quotes, then the values will be linked as in a proper sentence.
Example:

varA = "123"
varB = 123 

varA + varB = 123123

and

varB+varA = 246
Ans : B

Selected Answer: B
Answer = 'B', tested in uipath studio

Selected Answer: B
Test in Studio

comments.content: All the four option shows the same output.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Tested in studio, the answer is C.

Selected Answer: B
Answer B
Ans : C

Selected Answer: C
Answer = 'C', tested in uipath studio

choices.D: A runtime error will be thrown.
choices.B: DT1 is returned as an empty datatable.
choices.A: DT1 is unaffected by the settings of the Filter Wizard.
choices.C: DT1 is overwritten based on the settings of the Filter Wizard.

discussion.content:

Answer is C, Marie, Science remains

Selected Answer: C

If the main Column is DT1 then the answer is D.
The error will be: "Filter Data Table: the value for argument 'Column Name' is not set or is invalid."

Selected Answer: C
If you test this example in the studio, it will filter all rows that meet the condition. The end result will be:
ID Name Department

questions.question_text:
A developer has a datatable "dt_Companies" containing data for numerous companies. In the datatable, "RevenueSize" is a numeric column representing the current revenue in USD and "YearFounded" is a numeric column representing the year the company was founded. The developer needs to filter the datatable to obtain only companies that were founded after the year 2010 and also have revenues less than 500,000 USD.
What represents the configuration of the Filter Wizard of the Filter Data Table activity to obtain the output into the datatable, "dt_FilterCompanies"?
